content: The "Time for Schools Act of 1997" is the short title of this Act. General requirements for leave are outlined in the Act. The "Time for Schools Act of 1997" amends the Family and Medical Leave Act to provide eligible employees with 24 hours of leave per year for school involvement activities. This includes parent-teacher conferences, school interviews, and participation in family literacy programs. The "Time for Schools Act of 1997" allows eligible employees 24 hours of leave per year for school involvement activities, including parent-teacher conferences, school interviews, and participation in family literacy programs that involve interactive literacy activities, parent training, and education programs for children. The term 'literacy' refers to the ability to speak, read, write English, and solve problems necessary for functioning in various aspects of life. The term 'school' includes elementary and secondary schools. Employees can take up to 12 workweeks of leave for activities related to elementary or secondary schools, Head Start programs, and child care facilities meeting state or local licensing requirements. The "Time for Schools Act of 1997" allows eligible employees 24 hours of leave per year for school involvement activities. Leave under subsection (a)(3) may be taken intermittently or on a reduced schedule. Notice for school involvement leave requires at least 7 days' notice if foreseeable. The "Time for Schools Act of 1997" allows 24 hours of school involvement leave per year. Employees must provide notice for leave as soon as practicable. Employers can require certification for school involvement leave requests. SEC. 3. SCHOOL INVOLVEMENT LEAVE FOR CIVIL SERVICE EMPLOYEES. Employees are entitled to 24 hours of leave per year under section 6382(a) of title 5, United States Code, to participate in school activities for their children or family literacy programs. The curr_chunk discusses training for parents to be primary teachers and partners in their children's education, parent literacy training, and age-appropriate education programs. Literacy is defined as the ability to speak, read, write, and solve problems. The term "school" refers to an elementary school. The curr_chunk discusses the definition of a school as an elementary or secondary school, Head Start program, or child care facility. It also limits employee leave to 12 workweeks in a 12-month period and allows intermittent or reduced leave schedules. Paid leave substitution is also addressed. The curr_chunk amends sections related to substitution of paid leave, notice requirements for foreseeable leave, and certification for leave under subsection (a)(3) of the title. The curr_chunk adds a certification requirement for leave under section 6382(a)(3) of the title. The Act takes effect 120 days after enactment.
